disk

Class DiskUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • disk.DiskUnit

  • public class DiskUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains operations related to a disk unit. A DiskUnit is a sequence of a fixed number of bytes divided in blocks.
    Author:
    Jose Antonio Rodriguez Rivera

    • Method Detail

      • mount

        public static DiskUnit mount(java.lang.String name)
                      throws exceptions.NonExistingDiskException
        Turns on an existing disk unit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the disk unit to activate
        Returns:
        the corresponding DiskUnit object
        Throws:
        exceptions.NonExistingDiskException - whenever no disk with the specified name is found.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Turns off an existing disk unit.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
                           throws exceptions.ExistingDiskException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as having default capacity (number of blocks), each of default size (number of bytes). Those values are: DEFAULT_CAPACITY and DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE. The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        Throws:
        exceptions.ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name,
                                  int capacity,
                                  int blockSize)
                           throws exceptions.ExistingDiskException,
                                  java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as with the specified capacity (number of blocks), each of specified size (number of bytes). The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        capacity - number of blocks in the new disk
        blockSize - size per block in the new disk
        Throws:
        exceptions.ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - whenever the values for capacity or blockSize are not valid according to the specifications

      • write

        public void write(int blockNum,
                  VirtualDiskBlock b)
           throws exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException
        Writes the content of a VirtualDiskBlock into the corresponding block in the DiskUnit given by blockNum.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - the number of the block that's going to be written in
        b - the VirtualDiskBlock containing the data to be written
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever blockNum is an invalid number (less than 0 or more than capacity)

      • read

        public void read(int blockNum,
                 VirtualDiskBlock b)
          throws exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException
        Reads a block from the DiskUnit, given by blockNum. The data that is read will be copied to the VirtualDiskBlock b.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - the number of the block from where the data will be read
        b - the VirtualDiskBlock where the data will be copied to
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever blockNum is an invalid number (less than 0 or more than capacity)

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the disk. That is, the number of blocks the disk has.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of blocks the disk has

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Returns the number of bytes each disk block has.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes a block has

      • lowLevelFormat

        public void lowLevelFormat()
        Fills the disk unit with 0's (empties its contents). Also marks some blocks as damaged with a probability of 1 x 10^-5

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String name)
            throws exceptions.NonExistingDiskException
        Deletes this DiskUnit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this DiskUnit
        Throws:
        exceptions.NonExistingDiskException - if the disk does not exist

      • format

        public void format(java.lang.String name,
                   int capacity,
                   int blockSize)
            throws exceptions.NonExistingDiskException,
                   java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Formats this disk with the given capacity and block size.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this DiskUnit
        capacity - the number of blocks
        blockSize - the size of the blocks
        Throws:
        exceptions.NonExistingDiskException - if the disk does not exist
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - if capacity and/or block size are not powers of 2

      • showFreeBlocks

        public java.lang.String showFreeBlocks()
        Returns the free block structure.

      • getINodeManager

        public INodeManager getINodeManager()
        Returns the INodeManager for this DiskUnit.
        Returns:
        the INodeManager for this DiskUnit

      • getFBManager

        public FreeBlockManager getFBManager()
        Returns the FreeBlockManager for this DiskUnit.
        Returns:
        the FreeBlockManager for this DiskUnit
